oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women; Dresses
Women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Miss Susie Gentry posing in front of a matte painting of stairs. She wears a bustle dress, has a feathered hair accessory, and holds a fan possibly made of lace. One of her shoes is visible below her dress.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: White, W. W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Susie Gentry (1860-1944) was a genealogist, artist, composer, historian, and regent of the Old Glory Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution in Williamson County. She was the only child of Watson Meredith and Martha A. (Jones) Gentry. She is buried at Mt. Hope Cemetery in Franklin, Tennessee.
